intro: Reichardia picroides var. hypochoeriformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It features basal rosettes of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers with five petals. The plant is characterized by its finely divided leaves and is often found in moist, calcareous soils. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy and sometimes toxic plants. Reichardia picroides var. hypochoeriformis is typically found in meadows, woodland edges, and other open, sunny habitats.
